intro: Erodium guttatum subsp. libycum, commonly known as the desert bedstraw, is a small annual herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of pink or purple flowers with five petals, which bloom from spring to early summer. Its seeds are small and enclosed in a capsule, which splits open to release the seeds when mature. This species is adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
